intro: Duroia oocarpa, commonly known as the arrowroot plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that contain the seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Duroia oocarpa is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some medicinal uses in traditional practices.
